revised_title: The Croonian Lecture on Muscular Motion: The Role of Corneal Curvature, Axis of Vision, and Crystalline Lens in Eye Adjustment
tldr: This article investigates the role of corneal curvature, axis of vision, and the crystalline lens in the adjustment of the human eye. The author conducts experiments to determine the changes in the eye's structure and concludes that these changes are primarily due to the contraction of the four straight muscles of the eye.
